title: [K-12] Cognitive Load Theory-Based Auscultation Skill Instructional Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic anatomy and physiology knowledge, with understanding of fundamental medical procedures
context.additional_context: Smartphone-based learning environment, video/audio content-centered instruction, and staged diagnostic case applications

learning_goals: Learners can distinguish and document the five primary heart sounds (heart tones) with 80% accuracy.
Learners can identify three respiratory sounds (lung sounds) with 75% accuracy and explain their clinical significance.
Learners can execute a three-stage auscultation process (preparation-performance-verification) following a perceived auscultation protocol with 90% completion fidelity.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
